duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as the primary contact for incoming phone calls and emails, answering inquiries and/or forwarding to appropriate parties.
Manage the contact database and outlook email lists, producing a contact directory.
Coordinate in-house and off-site meetings, including scheduling, outreach, guest invitations, and logistical support.
Facilitate annual county visits process for executives, including scheduling and coordination.
Provide administrative support for staff, including document formatting, proof-reading, and meeting coordination.
Manage staff calendars for meetings, events, and travel, and coordinate travel arrangements.
Maintain the tidiness of common spaces and monitor/order office and meeting supplies.
Assist with physical mailings and prepare event materials as requested.
Plan and oversee participation in industry events, managing speaker confirmations, and assisting with physical mailings of invitations and brochures.
Staff on-site check-in and manage follow-up tasks as requested.
Assist with legislative tracking and coordination, planning meetings, and assisting with coordination and materials for legislative committee meetings.
Perform any other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Associates degree required, Bachelors degree preferred. Candidates with 5 years of administrative and database experience will be given special consideration.
